poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Not known, but it could be that the Naragansett Brought us the word 'kayak' but, when they sighted Boreray in cold eruption from the slanting deep, That votive pyre of gannets seeking some implacable god, Turned tail and set the outboard. Though of course, we tracked them home. To commune with the wild is beauty. Fear Is when it communes with you.
